alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Columbia, Suwannee and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Suwannee Springs, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, penny size hail, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Live Oak, White Springs, Suwannee Springs, Columbia, Wellborn, Five Points, Watertown, Winfield and Suwannee Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee
